title: How to Download Images by Batch from Canon Image Gateway

parts.name: Logging into Canon Image Gateway Library

steps.headline: Go to Canon Image Gateway.
steps.description: Use your web browser and go to http://www.canon.com/cig/.

steps.headline: Log in.
steps.description: Use the email address and password you used in registering to log in. Click the login button to proceed.

steps.headline: Go to Online Photo Album.
steps.description: At the top of the landing page is a huge banner link for the “Online Photo Album.” Click on it. You will be brought to the Canon Image Gateway Library.

steps.headline: Go to Album.
steps.description: On the header of the Canon Image Gateway Photo Album are two buttons, for “Library” and for “Album.” Click the “Album” button. You will be brought to the Albums page.

steps.headline: Create an album.
steps.description: Click the “Create Album” button to create a new album. You will be brought to the blank template for an Album.

steps.headline: Name the album.
steps.description: On the left side of the page are the album details. Enter the album’s title on the first field with the red asterisk.

steps.headline: Enter a comment.
steps.description: Under the album’s title is a big blank text field. Enter your notes or comments for the album here. This is optional.

steps.headline: Identify the album space.
steps.description: On the right side of the page is where you put the photos to be included in this album.

steps.headline: Select photos.
steps.description: All the photos in your library can be found on the bottom panel. Use the horizontal scroll bar to go left and right through the photos. Click the ones you want to be added to the album. Selected photos will appear inside a highlighted box.

steps.headline: Add photos to album.
steps.description: Drag the selected photos upward to the empty space, and drop them there. The photos will now show inside the album space in thumbnails.

steps.headline: Set an album cover.
steps.description: If you want to set an album cover from one of the album photos, select the photo, drag it over to the box on the topmost left of the page, and drop it there. The photo will now appear inside the box and will be used as the album cover photo.

steps.headline: Save the album.
steps.description: Click the red “;Create” button to create the album, along with all the photos you've put inside it.

steps.headline: Go to Album.
steps.description: On the header of the Canon Image Gateway Photo Album are two buttons, for “Library” and for “Album.” Click the “Album” button. You will be brought to the Albums page.

steps.headline: Select the album.
steps.description: From the list of albums, click the one you’d like to view and download. The album will load with all the pictures inside it in thumbnails.

steps.headline: Download the album.
steps.description: On the album header are three buttons. Click the one in the middle titled “Download Album.”

steps.headline: Install Album Plugin Utility.
steps.description: If it’s your first time to download an album, you will be asked to install the utility that supports downloading images by batch. You will be prompted by a dialogue window on the screen. Click the “Yes” button to confirm downloading and installing of this utility. If you already have this utility, disregard this step.

steps.headline: Select photos to download.
steps.description: The Album Plugin Utility will load. The selected album and all its photos will be shown. Ensure that the photos you want to be downloaded are ticked.

steps.headline: Download images.
steps.description: Once your selection is complete, click the “Download images” button on the lower right corner. Identify the destination folder on your computer, then wait for the download to finish. A progress dialogue box will appear.

steps.headline: View photos.
steps.description: Once the download is completed, you can now access your photos directly from your computer.

On the header of the Canon Image Gateway Photo Album are two buttons, for “Library” and for “Album.” Click the “Album” button. You will be brought to the Albums page. Create an album. Click the “Create Album” button to create a new album. You will be brought to the blank template for an Album. Name the album. On the left side of the page are the album details. Enter the album’s title on the first field with the red asterisk. Enter a comment. Under the album’s title is a big blank text field. Enter your notes or comments for the album here. This is optional. Populating the Album Identify the album space. On the right side of the page is where you put the photos to be included in this album. Select photos. All the photos in your library can be found on the bottom panel. Use the horizontal scroll bar to go left and right through the photos. Click the ones you want to be added to the album. Selected photos will appear inside a highlighted box. Add photos to album. Drag the selected photos upward to the empty space, and drop them there. The photos will now show inside the album space in thumbnails. Set an album cover. If you want to set an album cover from one of the album photos, select the photo, drag it over to the box on the topmost left of the page, and drop it there. The photo will now appear inside the box and will be used as the album cover photo. Save the album. Click the red “;Create” button to create the album, along with all the photos you've put inside it. Downloading the Album Go to Album. On the header of the Canon Image Gateway Photo Album are two buttons, for “Library” and for “Album.” Click the “Album” button. You will be brought to the Albums page. Select the album. From the list of albums, click the one you’d like to view and download. The album will load with all the pictures inside it in thumbnails. Download the album. On the album header are three buttons. Click the one in the middle titled “Download Album.” Install Album Plugin Utility. If it’s your first time to download an album, you will be asked to install the utility that supports downloading images by batch. You will be prompted by a dialogue window on the screen. Click the “Yes” button to confirm downloading and installing of this utility. If you already have this utility, disregard this step. Select photos to download. The Album Plugin Utility will load. The selected album and all its photos will be shown. Ensure that the photos you want to be downloaded are ticked. Download images. Once your selection is complete, click the “Download images” button on the lower right corner. Identify the destination folder on your computer, then wait for the download to finish. A progress dialogue box will appear. View photos. Once the download is completed, you can now access your photos directly from your computer.
